title: OpenType in Flash
content:
Hi there,

has anybody got an idea how I can embed a font with OpenType Contextual Alternates in flash? Is there a possibility to implement OpenType in Flash or do I have to do it with Actionscript? And can I somehow use these Contextual Alternates in Flash?  
I am trying to do something like this in flash:

[http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=liza&id2=test](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=liza&id2=test "http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=liza&id2=test")

Thanks a lot!
author: bezaubernd

comments.content:
I don't program Flash, so I can't give you exact detail, but I'm reminded of this post from 2008 by Thomas Phinney:

[http://blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2008/12/tlf\_rasterization.html#more](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2008/12/tlf_rasterization.html#more "http://blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2008/12/tlf\_rasterization.html#more")

which in turn points to things which in turn point to this:

[http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/tlf/Text+Layout+Framework](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/tlf/Text+Layout+Framework "http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/tlf/Text+Layout+Framework")

The current version of TLF does not support Contextual Alternates.

The OpenType functionality currently supported can be leveraged using the classes in the [flash.text.engine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/livedocs.adobe.com/flex/3/langref/flash/text/engine/package-detail.html) package.

If you haven't done so yet, try the [Text Layout Demo App](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/labs.adobe.com/technologies/textlayout/demos/). The TLF team has recently made available its [source code on their blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/blogs.adobe.com/tlf/2009/12/new-and-updated-tlf-samples.html).

The [Text Layout Framework](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/forums.adobe.com/community/opensource/tlf) forum is available for specific questions.

Thanks a lot for the quick responses.

Is it working on cs3? And does anybody know a tutorial or something to get started? Seems pretty complicated to me...

\> _Is it working on cs3?_

Flash CS3? No, but Contextual Alternates are available in InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop CS3.

\> _And does anybody know a tutorial or something to get started?_

There's an [introduction to TLF in Flex at the Adobe Developer Connection site](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/www.adobe.com/devnet/flex/articles/text_layout_framework.html) and the [Flex Examples site](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201907/http:/blog.flexexamples.com/) has a ton of code snippets. Hope this helps.
